OAuth 2.0 is currently not supported with this provider

GMail and another institutional mail account (IMAP) have been configured on both mail clients. When I compose and send a mail from the institutional mail account from either mail clients, the sent mail is not copied to the sent folder (on the client nor the server), though the email gets sent to the recipients. 
Please help resolve this issue. Thank you for designing the wonderful mobile mail clients!

title: Syncing deleted emails between Thunderbird Android and desktop versions
question_content:
I have Thunderbird for Android installed on my phone, and Thunderbird Desktop on my laptop. When I delete an email on my phone, the deletion does not then occur automatically on the desktop version. How can I sync deletions?

Note:
* I'm using an Outlook account.
* Even if I restart the app on my phone or pull down to refresh my inbox, the deletion does not occur on my phone.
* Conversely, if I delete an email on my laptop, then the deletion will occur on my phone (after refreshing it).

title: Low contrast in some emails/CSS inconsistently applied? (screenshots)
question_content:
Hi :)

I just wanted to provide info about an issue I'm having using Thunderbird. It's been present in past iterations since I installed a few months ago (before the rebrand), and I thought I'd mention it.

I'm finding that in dark theme, some text is unreadable due to low contrast (dark text on dark background). I am imagining the email likely has css/html clashing with my preferences? These emails are the only thing I use outlook for these days, as they render okay in there.

I have included how the email appears in thunderbird, then outlook by way of comparison.

I hope this is helpful, I'm happy to provide any information I can. :) Thank you for keeping this email client going, I love using it. :)

Many thanks,

Adam

title: No push notifications
question_content:
Hi,

I've recently switched from K9 to Thunderbird. Never had any issues with K9, just liked that Thunderbird was basically the same but without the dated look.

Thunderbird however does not send any push notifications.

What I've done this far:
-Re-install Thunderbird
-Check if Thunderbird has notification permissions (it does)
-Exclude Thunderbird from any and all power management

However, I still have not received a single push notification this far.


Does anyone know a workaround for this? Or is this maybe some kind of bug?


I'm using a Nokia G42 5G with stock Android 14.

title: Thunderbird for Android - POP Account and Creating local subfolders, Undeleting, and Printing Emails
question_content:
I was very excited to hear about Thunderbird for Android.  I have been using K-9 for years.  My account is a POP account.  I have only 3 gripes with K-9 that I hope are addressed in Thunderbird for Android.

1)  K-9 does not allow me to create local subfolders to organize my emails.  My inbox is a monster of disorganized emails and so the search option is my only friend.
2)  If I should accidentally delete an email in K-9 I cannot undelete it.
3)  K-9 has never provided a way to directly print emails.  I have to forward the email to my print server.

Please, can anyone tell me if these deficiencies have been addressed in Thunderbird for Android?

Many thanks.

Richard

title: Thunderbird for android is failing to synchronise data with email servers.
question_content:
Thunderbird for android is failing to synchronise data with email servers. Thunderbird for android is the exciting thing for people who prefer privacy and security as a default. But the transition from Top market email providers to thunderbird is not that smooth even after so much of testing the thunderbird android application still legs the reliability people look for a premium email client. The synchronisation with gmail and outlook servers is failing, it has to be manually synchronisation everyday or we don't get the latest emails.
This is a headache for users whose work depends upon email communication and they look forward to Mozilla for a private and secure email client.
Please I am a big supporter of open source and free internet but we need reliability for professional services.
Please fix 
Regards
A passionate User

title: Outlook configuration fails when setting up SMTP/Outgoing Server
question_content:

Security: StartTLS

Username: xxxx@outlook.com

title: Grand Canyon University
question_content:
This is precisely the problem but I can't find any way to get the GCU admistrator to do anything about it

A screen that indicates IT administrator approval is required for the app

    You must ask your administrator to authorize Thunderbird – approval must be done, but only once.
    Per Microsoft documentation, administrators should visit https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenant-id}/adminconsent?client_id=9e5f94bc-e8a4-4e73-b8be-63364c29d753 and grant the following permissions in order to authorize Mozilla Thunderbird: IMAP.AccessAsUser.All, POP.AccessAsUser.Al, SMTP.Send and offline_access

title: No notification
question_content:
Hello,
I have authorised notifications in the Thunderbird application for Android, but I don't receive any when I receive emails.
For your information, in Account Settings > Notifications, I checked the first box "Notifications of new emails" and the fifth box "Synchronisation notifications". What's more, in the "Notification categories" section (further down), in the screen that opens before "Emails", the "Alert" and "Application icon badges" boxes are ticked, and there's a sound associated with the "Sound" heading.
With all this, I don't get any notification of incoming emails.
Thank you for your help,
Kind regards,
Renaud
'''*Email removed to protect privacy*'''

title: Change "To Me" to an actual email address when reading mails

I am on old Eudora Thunderbird user and just installed Android Thunderbird.

title: Dark Theme Makes the Mail Body Parts Unreadable
question_content:
Hi folks, thanks for the amazing Thunderbird on Android.

I have a couple of observation I'd like to share.

1. When the device's theme is set to dark and Thunderbird follows, some parts of the email body becomes unreadable. This is not the case with Gmail (this is a Gmail account). I am attaching screenshots for this (1.jpeg for Gmail, 2.jpeg for Thunderbird). Is this an expected behavior?

2. The app seems to use green and violet colors for email body by default. And, it misses some of format colors of the email body itself. That is something I do not prefer. Is there a reason why Thunderbird chose this color and formatting? Is there a way to change the colors? Again attaching screenshots for this (please note the arrows I made especially, 3 for Gmail and 4 for Thunderbird and two others I did not number showing the green format (from Udemy)).

3. There are format problems with the Thunderbird (5 for Gmail and 6 for Thunderbird). Are these expected? It makes reading and seeing the mail problematic.

4. I think there is a problem with the way notification times are shown on Thunderbird. In the screenshot 7, you see that notification timestamp for Thunderbird is shown as 14:07. However, none of the emails shown just below have that time. Why would that be the case?

5. Lastly, even though the setting is set for Push, my emails come on average 10-25 minutes later than Gmail app itself. Is this also an expected behavior?

Thank you.

title: Notifications of New Emails Showing Twice
question_content:
I don't know if I just have something configured wrong or if this is a bug.

In case it is relevant, I originally came from the K-9 app and imported my settings to the new Thunderbird app. ''K-9 is now uninstalled''.

I have more than one account, and each inbox is set to show in Unified Inbox.

When I get any new email for any account, I actually get 2 of '''the exact same notification for each email'''. There '''isn't''' actually 2 emails with the same sender and subject line, when tapping on either of the notifications the app opens and there is just the one email.

I thought maybe Unified Inbox had its own notification setting which might explain why I was getting notified twice, but if there is I cannot find it.

I could always try removing all the accounts and re-adding them, but since I have quite a few I would like to avoid that if I can (and why I chose importing from K-9 rather than manually adding and configuring each one).

Thanks for any assistance.

title: Some questions
question_content:
Hi.

I have installed and set up the new app via the playstore.
Installed on a Pixel 8a.
I have noticed the following points. Please give me some feedback on where and how I have to change the settings or whether these points can be changed at all.

1. I have three mailboxes in the app. If you swipe to the right, you can see the overview of the mail accounts with a corresponding abbreviation of 2 letters. All three accounts are named “WE”.
It is possible to change that ?

2. I have set the frequency of mail retrieval to 15min. Can I set it somewhere so that I immediately receive a notification when mail arrives (background sync allways) ?

3. The retrieval of mails and their notifications do not work reliably.

How can this be optimized?

Thx.

Mero

title: Signing an e-mail
question_content:
As an enthusiastic Thunderbird user, I recently installed Thunderbird for Android and set it up using a QR code. Fantastic!

I always sign my outgoing emails with an OpenPGP certificate. I have integrated this on my smartphone using OpenKeychain. The question now is: how do I sign the outgoing emails?

The key is set up correctly with OpenKeyChain, the menu item ‘Activate encryption’ (German: ‘Verschlüsselung aktivieren’) is displayed, but not the menu item ‘Activate PGP-only signing’ (German: PGP-nur-Signieren aktivieren).

Hallo,

title: Refile/Move multiple messages (Android)
question_content:
I checked out multiple Support/forum posts first, but I found no matches, nor could I find this in the interface.

I just switched to Thunderbird yesterday, due to Microsoft's continually pushing their awful, new Outlook. I'm generally pleased, although I was stunned this morning to find that (when multiple messages are selected on my Android phone) there's no option on any of the More/... menus to Move/Refile all of them at once, if they're going to the same folder. I set one of my swipe actions to Move, but that only works for the individual email I'm swiping on.

Apparently, I have to move every single one separately, which is a pain if you're moving more than one or two. If there's no such option that I missed spotting, *PLEASE* add this to your road map ASAP, since it's a very basic feature to still be missing, for as long as Thunderbird has been around! All essential functions a user can do with one message must be available with multiple ones. Thanks!

Thanks

title: OAuth mixup between Yahoo and Rogers
question_content:
I have an @rogers.com email account and a few @yahoo.ca accounts, and have trouble setting them in Thunderbird for Android.  

Rogers uses Yahoo servers for mail access but has its own servers for authentication.  Ever since I first tried to set up my Rogers email account, Thunderbird has been sending me straight to the Rogers authentication page (rogersmembercentre.com) instead of the Yahoo page, regardless of whether the account that I am trying to set up is a Rrogers email or a Yahoo email (I tried both @yahoo.ca and @yahoo.com, and even @yahoo.pl).  Rogers then asks me to enter my email address again, and rejects it because it's not an @rogers.com address.

Before the first time I added a Rogers account, I'm pretty sure I had seen it work correctly: I entered my Yahoo email, Thunderbird asked me to confirm Yahoo's servers and port numbers, then sent me to the Yahoo authentication page, where I entered my password and there was no problem.  But it seems that the association of Yahoo mail server with the Rogers OAuth server got stuck somewhere, and I can't get it unstuck.  Even if I delete Thunderbird's data and/or uninstall it and reinstall it, it still sends me to the Rogers page when I try to add a Yahoo email account.  I guess this means that it's cached somewhere outside the Thunderbird app, maybe in some system cache of my phone, and it's possible that it's not a Thunderbird bug but an Android bug?
